title: The category of non-unital rings
content: The "category of non-unital rings" ` RngCat ` is the category of all non-unital rings ` Rng ` in a universe and non-unital ring homomorphisms ` RngHomo ` between these rings. This category is defined as "category restriction" of the category of extensible structures ` ExtStrCat `, which restricts the objects to non-unital rings and the morphisms to the non-unital ring homomorphisms, while the composition of morphisms is preserved, see ~ df-rngc . Alternately, the category of non-unital rings could have been defined as extensible structure consisting of three components/slots for the objects, morphisms and composition, see ~ df-rngcALTV or ~ dfrngc2 . Since we consider only "small categories" (i.e. categories whose objects and morphisms are actually sets and not proper classes), the objects of the category (i.e. the base set of the category regarded as extensible structure) are a subset of the non-unital rings (relativized to a subset or "universe" ` u `) ` ( u i^i Rng ) `, see ~ rngcbas , and the morphisms/arrows are the non-unital ring homomorphisms restricted to this subset of the non-unital rings ` ( RngHomo |`` ( B X. B ) ) `, see ~ rngchomfval , whereas the composition is the ordinary composition of functions, see ~ rngccofval and ~ rngcco . By showing that the non-unital ring homomorphisms between non-unital rings are a subcategory subset (` C_cat `) of the mappings between base sets of extensible structures, see ~ rnghmsscmap , it can be shown that the non-unital ring homomorphisms between non-unital rings are a subcategory (` Subcat `) of the category of extensible structures, see ~ rnghmsubcsetc . It follows that the category of non-unital rings ` RngCat ` is actually a category, see ~ rngccat with the identity function as identity arrow, see ~ rngcid .

df-rngc
blocks.content: Definition of the category Rng, relativized to a subset ` u ` . This is the category of all non-unital rings in ` u ` and homomorphisms between these rings. Generally, we will take ` u ` to be a weak universe or Grothendieck universe, because these sets have closure properties as good as the real thing. (Contributed by AV, 27-Feb-2020.) (Revised by AV, 8-Mar-2020.)

blocks.name: df-rngcALTV
blocks.content: Definition of the category Rng, relativized to a subset ` u ` . This is the category of all non-unital rings in ` u ` and homomorphisms between these rings. Generally, we will take ` u ` to be a weak universe or Grothendieck universe, because these sets have closure properties as good as the real thing. (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by AV, 27-Feb-2020.)

blocks.name: rngcval
blocks.content: Value of the category of non-unital rings (in a universe). (Contributed by AV, 27-Feb-2020.) (Revised by AV, 8-Mar-2020.)

thm rngcval(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, co(cfv(cestrc, c1), cresc, c2)))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(crngc, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c4, cin(c1, crng)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c2, cres(crngh, cxp(c4, c4))))
} = {
  syl5eq(c0, co(cfv(cestrc, c1), cresc, c2), cfv(crngc, c1), w0)
  fvmptd(hs0, crngc, c1, co(cfv(cestrc, c1), cresc, c2), universe, co(cfv(cestrc, cv(hs0)), cresc, cres(crngh, cxp(cin(cv(hs0), crng), cin(cv(hs0), crng)))), universe, w0)
  a1i(w0, wceq(crngc, cmpt(hs0, universe, co(cfv(cestrc, cv(hs0)), cresc, cres(crngh, cxp(cin(cv(hs0), crng), cin(cv(hs0), crng)))))))
  df-rngc(hs0)
  oveq12d(cfv(cestrc, cv(hs0)), cresc, cres(crngh, cxp(cin(cv(hs0), crng), cin(cv(hs0), crng))), cfv(cestrc, c1), c2, wa(w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))
  adantl(w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cfv(cestrc, cv(hs0)), cfv(cestrc, c1)))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c1, cestrc)
  eqtrd(cres(crngh, cxp(cin(cv(hs0), crng), cin(cv(hs0), crng))), c2, cres(crngh, cxp(c4, c4)), wa(w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))
  reseq2d(crngh, cxp(cin(cv(hs0), crng), cin(cv(hs0), crng)), cxp(c4, c4), wa(w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))
  sylan9eqr(cxp(cin(cv(hs0), crng), cin(cv(hs0), crng)), cxp(c4, c4), cxp(cin(c1, crng), cin(c1, crng)), w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  sqxpeqd(cin(cv(hs0), crng), cin(c1, crng), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  ineq1(cv(hs0), c1, crng)
  eqcomd(cxp(cin(c1, crng), cin(c1, crng)), cxp(c4, c4), w0)
  sqxpeqd(c4, cin(c1, crng), w0)
  adantr(w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cres(crngh, cxp(c4, c4)), c2))
  eqcomd(cres(crngh, cxp(c4, c4)), c2, w0)
  syl(w0, wcel(c1, universe), wcel(c1, c3))
  elex(c1, c3)
  ovexd(cfv(cestrc, c1), cresc, c2, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(co(cfv(cestrc, c1), cresc, c2))
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
}

  reseq2d(crngh, ((hs0 ‚ãÇ Rng)√ó(hs0 ‚ãÇ Rng)), (c4 √ó c4), (w0 ‚àß hs0 = c1))

  sqxpeqd((hs0 ‚ãÇ Rng), (c1 ‚ãÇ Rng), hs0 = c1)

blocks.name: rnghmresfn
blocks.content: The class of non-unital ring homomorphisms restricted to subsets of non-unital rings is a function. (Contributed by AV, 4-Mar-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm rnghmresfn(class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wfn(c0, cxp(c1, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c1, cin(c2, crng)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c0, cres(crngh, cxp(c1, c1))))
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wfn(c0, cxp(c1, c1)), wfn(cres(crngh, cxp(c1, c1)), cxp(c1, c1)))
  sylancr(w0, wfn(cres(crngh, cxp(c1, c1)), cxp(c1, c1)), wfn(crngh, cxp(crng, crng)), wss(cxp(c1, c1), cxp(crng, crng)))
  rnghmfn()
  syl2anc(w0, wss(cxp(c1, c1), cxp(crng, crng)), wss(c1, crng), wss(c1, crng))
  syl6eqss(c1, crng, cin(c2, crng), w0)
  inss2(c2, crng)
  xpss12(c1, crng, c1, crng)
  fnssres(crngh, cxp(crng, crng), cxp(c1, c1))
  fneq1d(c0, cxp(c1, c1), cres(crngh, cxp(c1, c1)), w0)
}

thm rngcbas(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(c0, cin(c1, crng)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(crngc, c1))
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c3))
} = {
  3eqtr4d(c0, cin(c1, crng), cfv(cbs, c2), cfv(cbs, co(cfv(cestrc, c1), cresc, cres(crngh, cxp(cin(c1, crng), cin(c1, crng))))), w0)
  fveq2d(cbs, c2, co(cfv(cestrc, c1), cresc, cres(crngh, cxp(cin(c1, crng), cin(c1, crng)))), w0)
  rngcval(c2, c1, cres(crngh, cxp(cin(c1, crng), cin(c1, crng))), c3, cin(c1, crng), w0)
  a1i(w0, wceq(c0, cfv(cbs, c2)))
  rescbas(cin(c1, crng), co(cfv(cestrc, c1), cresc, cres(crngh, cxp(cin(c1, crng), cin(c1, crng)))), cfv(cestrc, c1), cres(crngh, cxp(cin(c1, crng), cin(c1, crng))), cfv(cbs, cfv(cestrc, c1)), universe, w0)
  eqid(co(cfv(cestrc, c1), cresc, cres(crngh, cxp(cin(c1, crng), cin(c1, crng)))))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, cfv(cestrc, c1)))
  fvexd(cestrc, c1, w0)
  rnghmresfn(cres(crngh, cxp(cin(c1, crng), cin(c1, crng))), cin(c1, crng), c1, w0)
  eqidd(cin(c1, crng), w0)
  eqidd(cres(crngh, cxp(cin(c1, crng), cin(c1, crng))), w0)
  syl5sseq(cin(c1, crng), cfv(cbs, cfv(cestrc, c1)), c1, w0)
  inss1(c1, crng)
  estrcbas(c1, cfv(cestrc, c1), c3, w0)
  eqid(cfv(cestrc, c1))
}

  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0 =(c1 ‚ãÇ Rng))

blocks.name: rnghmsscmap2
blocks.content: The non-unital ring homomorphisms between non-unital rings (in a universe) are a subcategory subset of the mappings between base sets of non-unital rings (in the same universe). (Contributed by AV, 6-Mar-2020.)

blocks.name: rnghmsscmap
blocks.content: The non-unital ring homomorphisms between non-unital rings (in a universe) are a subcategory subset of the mappings between base sets of extensible structures (in the same universe). (Contributed by AV, 9-Mar-2020.)

  3sstr4d(co(cv(hs0), cres(crngh, cxp(c0, c0)), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs0), cmpo(s0, s1, c1, c1, co(cfv(cbs, cv(s1)), cmap, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)))), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs0), crngh, cv(hs1)), co(cfv(cbs, cv(hs1)), cmap, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0))), wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs1), c0))))

blocks.name: rnghmsubcsetc
blocks.content: The non-unital ring homomorphisms between non-unital rings (in a universe) are a subcategory of the category of extensible structures. (Contributed by AV, 9-Mar-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm rnghmsubcsetc(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csubc, c1)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cestrc, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c4, cin(crng, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(c0, cres(crngh, cxp(c4, c4))))
} = {
  mpbir2and(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(csubc, c1)), wbr(c0, cssc, cfv(chomf, c1)), wral(hs0, c4, wa(wcel(cfv(cfv(ccid, c1), cv(hs0)), co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs0))), wral(hs3, c4, wral(hs4, c4, wral(hs2, co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs3)), wral(hs1, co(cv(hs3), c0, cv(hs4)), wcel(co(cv(hs1), co(cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs3)), cfv(cco, c1), cv(hs4)), cv(hs2)), co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs4))))))))))
  3brtr4d(c0, cssc, cfv(chomf, c1), cres(crngh, cxp(c4, c4)), cmpo(hs0, hs3, c2, c2, co(cfv(cbs, cv(hs3)), cmap, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)))), w0)
  rnghmsscmap(hs0, hs3, c4, c2, c3, w0)
  eqtrd(cfv(chomf, c1), cmpo(hs0, hs3, c2, c2, co(cfv(cbs, cv(hs3)), cmap, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)))), cfv(chom, c1), w0)
  estrchomfeqhom(c1, cfv(chom, c1), c2, c3, w0)
  estrchomfval(hs0, hs3, cfv(chom, c1), c2, c1, c3, w0)
  eqid(cfv(chom, c1))
  ralrimiva(hs0, c4, w0, wa(wcel(cfv(cfv(ccid, c1), cv(hs0)), co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs0))), wral(hs3, c4, wral(hs4, c4, wral(hs2, co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs3)), wral(hs1, co(cv(hs3), c0, cv(hs4)), wcel(co(cv(hs1), co(cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs3)), cfv(cco, c1), cv(hs4)), cv(hs2)), co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs4)))))))))
  jca(wa(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wcel(cfv(cfv(ccid, c1), cv(hs0)), co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs0))), wral(hs3, c4, wral(hs4, c4, wral(hs2, co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs3)), wral(hs1, co(cv(hs3), c0, cv(hs4)), wcel(co(cv(hs1), co(cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs3)), cfv(cco, c1), cv(hs4)), cv(hs2)), co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs4))))))))
  rnghmsubcsetclem1(hs0, c4, c1, c0, c2, c3, w0)
  rnghmsubcsetclem2(hs0, hs3, hs4, hs2, hs1, c4, c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  issubc2(hs0, hs3, hs4, hs2, hs1, c0, c1, cfv(chomf, c1), c4, cfv(ccid, c1), cfv(cco, c1), w0)
  eqid(cfv(chomf, c1))

  eqid(cfv(cco, c1))
  syl(w0, wcel(c1, ccat), wcel(c2, c3))

blocks.name: rngciso
blocks.content: An isomorphism in the category of non-unital rings is a bijection. (Contributed by AV, 28-Feb-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm rngciso(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wcel(c0, co(c1, c2, c3)), wcel(c0, co(c1, crngs, c3))))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(crngc, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c6))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ciso, c4))
} = {
  bitrd(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, c2, c3)), wcel(c0, co(c1, crngs, c3)), wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))))
  eleq2d(c0, co(c1, c2, c3), cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3)), w0)
  isoval(c1, c2, c3, cfv(cinv, c4), c6, c4, w0)
  impbid(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))), wcel(c0, co(c1, crngs, c3)))
  sylbid(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))), wcel(c0, co(c1, crngs, c3)), wbr(c0, co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), cfv(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0)))
  syl(w0, wb(wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))), wbr(c0, co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), cfv(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0))), wfun(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3)))
  funfvbrb(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0)
  syl6bi(w0, wbr(c0, co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), cfv(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0)), wcel(c0, co(c1, crngs, c3)), wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, crngs, c3)), wceq(cfv(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0), ccnv(c0))))
  rngcinv(c0, c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3, cfv(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0), c4, c5, c6, c7, w0)
  simpl(wcel(c0, co(c1, crngs, c3)), wceq(cfv(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0), ccnv(c0)))
  mpan2i(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, crngs, c3)), wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))), wceq(ccnv(c0), ccnv(c0)))
  eqid(ccnv(c0))
  sylbird(w0, wa(wcel(c0, co(c1, crngs, c3)), wceq(ccnv(c0), ccnv(c0))), wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))), wbr(c0, co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), ccnv(c0)))
  rngcinv(c0, c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3, ccnv(c0), c4, c5, c6, c7, w0)
  syl(w0, wi(wbr(c0, co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), ccnv(c0)), wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3)))), wrel(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3)))
  syl(w0, wrel(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3)), wfun(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3)))
  invfun(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3, c6, c4, w0)
  eqid(cfv(cinv, c4))
  syl(w0, wcel(c4, ccat), wcel(c5, c7))

thm rngcidALTV(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, c1), cres(cid, c2)))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c5))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c1))
} = {
  syl6eqr(cfv(c0, c1), cres(cid, c2), cres(cid, cfv(cbs, c1)), w0)
  fvmptd(hs0, c0, c1, cres(cid, cfv(cbs, c1)), c5, cres(cid, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0))), universe, w0)
  syl5eq(c0, cmpt(hs0, c5, cres(cid, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)))), cfv(ccid, c3), w0)
  simprd(w0, wceq(cfv(ccid, c3), cmpt(hs0, c5, cres(cid, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0))))), wcel(c3, ccat))

  rngccatidALTV(hs0, c4, c6, c3, c5)
  reseq2d(cid, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), cfv(cbs, c1), wa(w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1)))
  adantl(w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cfv(cbs, cv(hs0)), cfv(cbs, c1)))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), c1, cbs)
  mp1i(w0, wcel(cres(cid, cfv(cbs, c1)), universe), wcel(cfv(cbs, c1), universe))
  fvex(cbs, c1)

  fveq2(hs0, c1, cbs)
  mp1i(w0, (= |`(Base ` c1))‚àà ùïå, (Base ` c1)‚àà ùïå)

thm rngcsectALTV(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0[(c1[c2]c3)]c4 ‚Üî(c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1)‚àß(c4 ‚àò c0)=(= |` c5))))
  ‚ä£ c6 =(RngCatALTV ` c7)
  ‚ä£ c8 =(Base ` c6)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c7 ‚àà c9)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà c8)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c3 ‚àà c8)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(Base ` c1)
  ‚ä£ c2 =(Sect ` c6)
} = {
  bitrd(w0, c0[(c1[c2]c3)]c4, (c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1)‚àß(c4 ‚àò c0)=(= |` c5)), (c0 ‚àà(c1[(Hom ` c6)]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[(Hom ` c6)]c1)‚àß(c4[(< c1, c3 >[(comp ` c6)]c1)]c0)=((Id ` c6)` c1)))
  issect(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, (Hom ` c6), (comp ` c6), (Id ` c6), c8, c6, w0)
  syl(w0, c6 ‚àà Cat, c7 ‚àà c9)
  rngccatALTV(c7, c9, c6)
  3bitr4g(w0, (c0 ‚àà(c1[(Hom ` c6)]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[(Hom ` c6)]c1)‚àß(c4[(< c1, c3 >[(comp ` c6)]c1)]c0)=((Id ` c6)` c1)), (c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1)‚àß(c4 ‚àò c0)=(= |` c5)), ((c0 ‚àà(c1[(Hom ` c6)]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[(Hom ` c6)]c1))‚àß(c4[(< c1, c3 >[(comp ` c6)]c1)]c0)=((Id ` c6)` c1)), ((c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1))‚àß(c4 ‚àò c0)=(= |` c5)))
  bitrd(w0, ((c0 ‚àà(c1[(Hom ` c6)]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[(Hom ` c6)]c1))‚àß(c4[(< c1, c3 >[(comp ` c6)]c1)]c0)=((Id ` c6)` c1)), ((c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1))‚àß(c4 ‚àò c0)=(= |` c5)), ((c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1))‚àß(c4[(< c1, c3 >[(comp ` c6)]c1)]c0)=((Id ` c6)` c1)))
  anbi1d(w0, (c0 ‚àà(c1[(Hom ` c6)]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[(Hom ` c6)]c1)), (c4[(< c1, c3 >[(comp ` c6)]c1)]c0)=((Id ` c6)` c1), (c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1)))
  anbi12d(w0, c0 ‚àà(c1[(Hom ` c6)]c3), c4 ‚àà(c3[(Hom ` c6)]c1), c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3), c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1))
  eleq2d(c0, (c1[(Hom ` c6)]c3), (c1[RngHomo]c3), w0)
  rngchomALTV(c1, (Hom ` c6), c3, c6, c7, c8, c9, w0)
  eleq2d(c4, (c3[(Hom ` c6)]c1), (c3[RngHomo]c1), w0)
  rngchomALTV(c3, (Hom ` c6), c1, c6, c7, c8, c9, w0)
  eqid((Hom ` c6))
  pm5.32da(w0, (c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1)), (c4[(< c1, c3 >[(comp ` c6)]c1)]c0)=((Id ` c6)` c1), (c4 ‚àò c0)=(= |` c5))
  eqeq12d((c4[(< c1, c3 >[(comp ` c6)]c1)]c0), ((Id ` c6)` c1), (c4 ‚àò c0), (= |` c5), (w0 ‚àß(c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1))))
  rngccoALTV(c4, c1, c3, (comp ` c6), c1, c0, c6, c7, c8, c9, (w0 ‚àß(c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1))))
  adantr(w0, (c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1)), c7 ‚àà c9)
  eqid((comp ` c6))
  adantr(w0, (c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1)), c3 ‚àà c8)
  adantr(w0, (c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1)), c1 ‚àà c8)
  simprl(w0, c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3), c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1))
  simprr(w0, c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3), c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1))
  adantr(w0, (c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3)‚àß c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1)), ((Id ` c6)` c1)=(= |` c5))
  rngcidALTV((Id ` c6), c1, c5, c6, c7, c8, c9, w0)
  eqid((Id ` c6))
  df-3an(c0 ‚àà(c1[(Hom ` c6)]c3), c4 ‚àà(c3[(Hom ` c6)]c1), (c4[(< c1, c3 >[(comp ` c6)]c1)]c0)=((Id ` c6)` c1))
  df-3an(c0 ‚àà(c1[RngHomo]c3), c4 ‚àà(c3[RngHomo]c1), (c4 ‚àò c0)=(= |` c5))

blocks.content: An inverse in the category of non-unital rings is the converse operation. (Contributed by AV, 28-Feb-2020.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: rngcisoALTV
blocks.content: An isomorphism in the category of non-unital rings is a bijection. (Contributed by AV, 28-Feb-2020.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm rngcisoALTV(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wcel(c0, co(c1, c2, c3)), wcel(c0, co(c1, crngs, c3))))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(crngcALTV, c5))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c6))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ciso, c4))
} = {
  bitrd(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, c2, c3)), wcel(c0, co(c1, crngs, c3)), wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))))
  eleq2d(c0, co(c1, c2, c3), cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3)), w0)
  isoval(c1, c2, c3, cfv(cinv, c4), c6, c4, w0)
  impbid(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))), wcel(c0, co(c1, crngs, c3)))
  sylbid(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))), wcel(c0, co(c1, crngs, c3)), wbr(c0, co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), cfv(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0)))
  syl(w0, wb(wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3))), wbr(c0, co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), cfv(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3), c0))), wfun(co(c1, cfv(cinv, c4), c3)))

blocks.name: funcrngcsetc
blocks.content: The "natural forgetful functor" from the category of non-unital rings into the category of sets which sends each non-unital ring to its underlying set (base set) and the morphisms (non-unital ring homomorphisms) to mappings of the corresponding base sets. An alternate proof is provided in ~ funcrngcsetcALT , using ~ cofuval2 to construct the "natural forgetful functor" from the category of non-unital rings into the category of sets by composing the "inclusion functor" from the category of non-unital rings into the category of extensible structures, see ~ rngcifuestrc , and the "natural forgetful functor" from the category of extensible structures into the category of sets, see ~ funcestrcsetc . (Contributed by AV, 26-Mar-2020.)

blocks.name: funcrngcsetcALT
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ funcrngcsetc , using ~ cofuval2 to construct the "natural forgetful functor" from the category of non-unital rings into the category of sets by composing the "inclusion functor" from the category of non-unital rings into the category of extensible structures, see ~ rngcifuestrc , and the "natural forgetful functor" from the category of extensible structures into the category of sets, see ~ funcestrcsetc . Surprisingly, this proof is longer than the direct proof given in ~ funcrngcsetc . (Contributed by AV, 30-Mar-2020.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:

  mpdan((w0 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà(Base ` c1)), ((hs2 ‚àà(Base ` hs1)‚Ü¶(0 ` c0))‚àà(hs1[RngHomo]c0)‚àß(hs2 ‚àà(Base ` hs1)‚Ü¶(0 ` c0))‚àà(hs1[(Hom ` c1)]c0)‚àß ‚àÄ(hs0,(hs0 ‚àà(hs1[(Hom ` c1)]c0)‚Üí hs0 =(hs2 ‚àà(Base ` hs1)‚Ü¶(0 ` c0))))), (hs2 ‚àà(Base ` hs1)‚Ü¶(0 ` c0))‚àà(hs1[RngHomo]c0))

blocks.name: zrzeroorngc
blocks.content: The zero ring is a zero object in the category of non-unital rings. (Contributed by AV, 18-Apr-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm zrzeroorngc(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(czeroo, c1)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c3))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(crngc, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cdif(crg, cnzr)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c2))
} = {
  mpbir2and(w0, wcel(c0, cfv(czeroo, c1)), wcel(c0, cfv(cinito, c1)), wcel(c0, cfv(ctermo, c1)))
  zrinitorngc(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  zrtermorngc(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  iszeroo(c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c1), cfv(chom, c1), w0)
  eqid(cfv(chom, c1))
  syl(w0, wcel(c1, ccat), wcel(c2, c3))
  rngccat(c2, c3, c1)
  eleqtrrd(c0, cfv(cbs, c1), cin(c2, crng), w0)
  elind(c0, c2, crng, w0)
  syl(w0, wcel(c0, crng), wcel(c0, crg))
  eldifad(c0, crg, cnzr, w0)
  ringrng(c0)
  rngcbas(cfv(cbs, c1), c2, c1, c3, w0)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c1))
}

thm zrzeroorngc(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà(ZeroO ` c1))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà c3)
  ‚ä£ c1 =(RngCat ` c2)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà(Ring \ NzRing))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà c2)
} = {
  mpbir2and(w0, c0 ‚àà(ZeroO ` c1), c0 ‚àà(InitO ` c1), c0 ‚àà(TermO ` c1))
  zrinitorngc(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  zrtermorngc(c0, c1, c2, c3, w0)
  iszeroo(c0, c1, (Base ` c1), (Hom ` c1), w0)
  eqid((Hom ` c1))
  syl(w0, c1 ‚àà Cat, c2 ‚àà c3)
  rngccat(c2, c3, c1)
  eleqtrrd(c0, (Base ` c1), (c2 ‚ãÇ Rng), w0)
  elind(c0, c2, crng, w0)
  syl(w0, c0 ‚àà Rng, c0 ‚àà Ring)
  eldifad(c0, crg, cnzr, w0)
  ringrng(c0)
  rngcbas((Base ` c1), c2, c1, c3, w0)
  eqid((Base ` c1))
}
